page.title: 02MOSSLEY Cont.
page.content: Tameside Metropolitan Borough. New industries have replaced the old in the form of chemical and engineering works, unfortunately on a much smaller scale.New residential developments now occupy the valley. However, with the help of Green Belt and conservation policies the essential character of Mossley remains and the town continues to expand albeit as a dormitory town for the larger towns in the Greater Manchester area. Although Mossley is the principal population centre in the block, most of it is composed of open moorland with the lower areas being used for rough grazing. In the Valley bottom by the River Tame and the Huddersfield Narrow Canal, the main features are the familiar signs of the relics of a once thriving cotton and woollen town.
